verses.verse: The words<WH1697> of Nehemiah<WH5166> the son<WH1121> of Hacaliah<WH2446>. Now it came to pass in the month<WH2320> Chislev<WH3691>, in the twentieth<WH6242> year<WH8141>, as I was in Shushan<WH7800> the palace<WH1002>,

that Hanani<WH2607>, one<WH259> of my brethren<WH251>, came<WH935>, he and certain men<WH582> out of Judah<WH3063>; and I asked<WH7592> them concerning the Jews<WH3064> that had escaped<WH6413>, that were left<WH7604> of the captivity<WH7628>, and concerning Jerusalem<WH3389>.

And they said<WH559> unto me<WH7604>, The remnant that are left<WH7604> of the captivity<WH7628> there in the province<WH4082> are in great<WH1419> affliction<WH7451> and reproach<WH2781>: the wall<WH2346> of Jerusalem<WH3389> also is broken down<WH6555>, and the gates<WH8179> thereof are burned<WH3341> with fire<WH784>.

And it came to pass<WH8085>, when I heard these words<WH1697>, that I sat down<WH3427> and wept<WH1058>, and mourned<WH56> certain days<WH3117>; and I fasted<WH6684> and prayed<WH6419> before<WH6440> the God<WH430> of heaven<WH8064>,

and said<WH559>, I beseech<WH577> thee<WH3068>, O Jehovah, the God<WH430> of heaven<WH8064>, the great<WH1419> and terrible<WH3372> God<WH410>, that keepeth<WH8104> covenant<WH1285> and lovingkindness<WH2617> with them that love<WH157> him and keep<WH8104> his commandments<WH4687>:

Let thine ear<WH241> now be attentive<WH7183>, and thine eyes<WH5869> open<WH6605>, that thou mayest hearken<WH8085> unto the prayer<WH8605> of thy servant<WH5650>, which I pray<WH6419> before<WH6440> thee at this time<WH3117>, day<WH3119> and night<WH3915>, for the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> thy servants<WH5650> while I confess<WH3034> the sins<WH2403> of the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>, which we have sinned<WH2398> against thee<WH1>. Yea, I and my father's house<WH1004> have sinned<WH2398>:

we have dealt very<WH2254> corruptly<WH2254> against thee<WH8104>, and have not kept the commandments<WH4687>, nor the statutes<WH2706>, nor the ordinances<WH4941>, which thou commandedst<WH6680> thy servant<WH5650> Moses<WH4872>.

Remember <WH2142>, I beseech thee<WH1697>, the word that thou commandedst<WH6680> thy servant<WH5650> Moses<WH4872>, saying<WH559>, If ye trespass<WH4603>, I will scatter you abroad<WH6327> among the peoples<WH5971>:

but if ye return<WH7725> unto me<WH8104>, and keep my commandments<WH4687> and do<WH6213> them<WH5080>, though your outcasts were in the uttermost part<WH7097> of the heavens<WH8064>, yet will I gather<WH6908> them from thence<WH935>, and will bring them unto the place<WH4725> that I have chosen<WH977>, to cause my name<WH8034> to dwell there<WH7931>.
Now these are thy servants<WH5650> and thy people<WH5971>, whom thou hast redeemed<WH6299> by thy great<WH1419> power<WH3581>, and by thy strong<WH2389> hand<WH3027>.

O Lord<WH136>, I beseech<WH577> thee<WH241>, let now thine ear be attentive<WH7183> to the prayer<WH8605> of thy servant<WH5650>, and to the prayer<WH8605> of thy servants<WH5650>, who delight<WH2655> to fear<WH3372> thy name<WH8034>; and prosper<WH6743>, I pray thee<WH5650>, thy servant this day<WH3117>, and grant<WH5414> him mercy<WH7356> in the sight<WH6440> of this man<WH376>. Now I was cupbearer<WH8248> to the king<WH4428>.
